sentences.en: Outside, the pitiless rain fell , fell steadily, with a fierce malignity that was all too human.
sentences.cn: 外面下着无情的雨, 不断地下着, 简直跟通人性那样凶狠而恶毒.

sentences.en: Scorn, bitterness, unprovoked malignity, gratuitous desire of ill, ridicule of whatever was good and holy, all awoke, to tempt, even while they frightened him.
sentences.cn: 轻蔑、狠毒、无缘无故的恶言秽行和歹意；对善良和神圣的事物妄加嘲弄，这一切全都绘唤醒起来，虽说把他吓得要命，却仍在诱惑着他。

sentences.en: The everlasting verdure of Milton's laurels has nothing to fear from the blasts of malignity.
sentences.cn: 密尔顿诗人桂冠之树的永恒茂盛,根本不怕一阵狠毒的飓风刮来.

sentences.en: The little witch put a mock malignity into her beautiful eyes, and Joseph, trembling with sincere horror, hurried out praying and ejaculating " wicked " as he went.
sentences.cn: 这个小女巫那双美丽的眼睛里添上一种嘲弄的恶毒神气. 约瑟夫真的吓得直抖, 赶紧跑出去,一边跑一边祷告,还嚷着 “ 恶毒! ”

sentences.en: The little witch put a mock malignity into her beautiful eyes, and Joseph, trembling with sincere horror, hurried out praying and ejaculating `wicked' as he went.
sentences.cn: 这个小女巫那双美丽的眼睛里添上一种嘲弄的恶毒神气。 约瑟夫真的吓得直抖，赶紧跑出去，一边跑一边祷告，还嚷着“恶毒！”

words.tran_cn: 恶意的；恶毒的；蓄意的；怀恨的
[医] 恶性的；有害的；有恶意的

trans.tran_cn: 极度的恶意，恶毒，（病的）恶性
trans.tran_en: the condition or quality of being malign, malevolent, or deadly
